body_html:
@peterjc123, thanks. Yes, I have numpy and mkl installed. The problem comes when I try to pip install pytorch:

  1. Your repo page: I looked on your repo page, but the Windows installs are all conda which I'd prefer to avoid if possible. I'd prefer to use pip if I can.

  2. On the compiled whl's page, should I be looking for pytorch.whl? If so, I'm not seeing it there.

Thanks

Max

On the compiled whl's page, should I be looking for pytorch.whl? If so, I'm not seeing it there.

body:
@peterjc123, thanks. Yes, I have numpy and mkl installed. The problem comes when I try to pip install pytorch:

1. Your repo page: I looked on your repo page, but the Windows installs are all conda which I'd prefer to avoid if possible. I'd prefer to use pip if I can.

2. On the compiled whl's page, should I be looking for pytorch.whl? If so, I'm not seeing it there.

Thanks

Max
